question.title: Question: 1
question.questionText: The cantilever wing uses.

answer.answerText: the skin to carry most of the load to the wing butt.

question.title: Question: 2
question.questionText: Moisture, mildew, chemicals, and acids have no effect on

question.title: Question: 3
question.questionText: The strength classification of fabrics used in aircraft covering is based on

question.title: Question: 4
question.questionText: Before spraying any finishing materials on unpainted clean aluminum,

answer.answerText: wipe the surface with avgas or kerosene.
avoid touching the surface with bare hands

question.title: Question: 5
question.questionText: A well-designed rivet joint will subject the rivets to

question.title: Question: 6
question.questionText: A main difference between Lockbolt/Huckbolt tension and shear fasteners (other than their application) is in the

question.title: Question: 7
question.questionText: One of the main advantages of Hi-Lok type fasteners over earlier generations is that

answer.answerText: they can be removed and reused again.
the sueezed on collar installation provides a more secure, tighter fit.
they can be installed with ordinary hand tools

question.title: Question: 8
question.questionText: Hole filling fasteners (for example, MS20470 rivets) should not be used in composite structures primarily because of the

answer.answerText: increased possibility of fretting corrosion in the fastener.
difficulty in forming a proper shop head

question.title: Question: 9
question.questionText: Metal fasteners used with carbon/graphite composite structures

answer.answerText: may be constructed of any of the metals commonly used in aircraft fasteners.
must be constructed of material such as titanium or corrosion resistant steel
must be constructed of high strength aluminumlithium alloy.

question.title: Question: 10
question.questionText: Sandwich panels made of metal honeycomb construction are used on modern aircraft because this type of construction

answer.answerText: has a high strength to weight ratio
may be repaired by gluing replacement skin to the inner core material with thermoplastic resin.
is lighter than single sheet skin of the same strength and is more corrosion resistant.

question.title: Question: 11
question.questionText: (1) When performing a ring (coin tap) test on composite structures, a change in sound may be due to damage or to transition to a different internal structure. (2)The extent of separation damage in composite structures is most accurately measured by a ring (coin tap) test. Regarding the above statements,

answer.answerText: both No. 1 and No. 2 are true.

question.title: Question: 12
question.questionText: Which of these methods may be used to inspect fiberglass/honeycomb structures for entrapped water? 1. Acoustic emission monitoring. 2. X-ray. 3. Backlighting.

question.title: Question: 13
question.questionText: Composite inspections conducted by means of acoustic emission monitoring

answer.answerText: pick up the “noise” of corrosion or other deterioration occurring
analyze ultrasonic signals transmitted into the parts being inspected
create sonogram pictures of the areas being inspected

question.title: Question: 14
question.questionText: What precaution, if any, should be taken to prevent corrosion inside a repaired metal honeycomb structure?

answer.answerText: Prime the repair with a corrosion inhibitor and seal from the atmosphere
Paint the outside area with several coats of exterior paint.
None. Honeycomb is usually made from a man-made or fibrous material which is not susceptible to corrosion.

question.title: Question: 15
question.questionText: One method of inspecting a laminated fiberglass structure that has been subjected to damage is to

answer.answerText: strip the damaged area of all paint and shine a strong light through the structure
use dye-penetrant inspection procedures, exposing the entire damaged area to the penetrant solution.
use an eddy current probe on both sides of the damaged area

question.title: Question: 16
question.questionText: The classification for high tensile strength fiber-glass used in aircraft structures is

question.title: Question: 17
question.questionText: The classification for fiberglass reinforcement material that has high resistivity and is the most common is

question.title: Question: 18
question.questionText: An airplane is controlled directionally about its vertical axis by the

question.title: Question: 19
question.questionText: The elevators of a conventional airplane are used to provide rotation about the

question.title: Question: 20
question.questionText: The chord of a wing is measured from

question.title: Question: 21
question.questionText: When the lift of an airfoil increases, the drag will

answer.answerText: increase while the lift is changing but will return to its original value.

question.title: Question: 22
question.questionText: The purpose of wing slats is to

question.title: Question: 23
question.questionText: When inspecting a control cable turnbuckle for proper installation, determine that

answer.answerText: no more than four threads are exposed on either side of the turnbuckle barrel.
the terminal end threads are visible through the safety hole in the barrel.
the safety wire ends are wrapped a minimum of four turns around the terminal end shanks

question.title: Question: 24
question.questionText: The purpose of the vertical fin is to provide

question.title: Question: 25
question.questionText: Excessive wear on both of the sides of a control cable pulley groove is evidence of

question.title: Question: 26
question.questionText: Stability about the axis which runs parallel to the line of flight is referred to as

question.title: Question: 27
question.questionText: A stripe or mark applied to a wheel rim and extending onto the sidewall of a tube- type tire is a

question.title: Question: 28
question.questionText: When bleeding aircraft brakes, one of the indications that the air has been purged from the system is

question.title: Question: 29
question.questionText: Overinflated aircraft tires may cause damage to the

question.title: Question: 30
question.questionText: An embossed letter “H” on an air valve core stem

question.title: Question: 31
question.questionText: The primary purpose for balancing aircraft wheel assemblies is to

answer.answerText: Prevent heavy spots and reduce vibration

question.title: Question: 32
question.questionText: On all aircraft equipped with retractable landing gear, some means must be provided to

answer.answerText: Retract and extend the landing gear if the normal operating mechanism fails.
Extend the landing gear if the normal operating mechanism fails
Prevent the throttle from being reduced below a safe power setting while the landing gear is retracted

question.title: Question: 33
question.questionText: What is the purpose of the torque links attached to the cylinder and piston of a landing gear oleo strut?

question.title: Question: 34
question.questionText: Aircraft brakes requiring a large volume of fluid to operate the brakes generally

answer.answerText: Do not use brake system accumulators.

question.title: Question: 35
question.questionText: When an air/oil type of landing gear shock strut is used, the initial shock of landing is cushioned by

answer.answerText: The fluid being forced through a metered opening

question.title: Question: 36
question.questionText: A sleeve, spacer, or bumper ring is incorporated in a landing gear oleo shock strut to

answer.answerText: Limit the extension of the torque arm.

question.title: Question: 37
question.questionText: The purpose of a sequence valve in a hydraulic retractable landing gear system is to

answer.answerText: Prevent heavy landing gear from falling too rapidly upon extension.
Provide a means of disconnecting the normal source of hydraulic power and connecting the emergency source of power.
Ensure operation of the landing gear and gear doors in the proper order

question.title: Question: 38
question.questionText: The pressure source for power brakes is

question.title: Question: 39
question.questionText: Which statement is true with respect to an aircraft equipped with hydraulically operated multiple-disk type brake assemblies?

answer.answerText: There are no minimum or maximum disk clearance checks required due to the use of self-compensating cylinder assemblies.
Do not set parking brake when brakes are hot
No parking brake provisions are possible for this type of brake assembly.

question.title: Question: 40
question.questionText: What type of valve is used in the brake actuating line to isolate the emergency brake system from the normal power brake control valve system?

question.title: Question: 41
question.questionText: Instructions concerning the type of fluid and amount of air pressure to be put in a shock strut are found

answer.answerText: In the aircraft manufacture’s service manual

question.title: Question: 42
question.questionText: The purpose of a relief valve in a brake system is to

question.title: Question: 43
question.questionText: Aircraft tire pressure should be checked

answer.answerText: Using only a push on stick-type gauge having 1-pound increments.
At least once a week or more often
As soon as possible after each flight.

question.title: Question: 44
question.questionText: What is the purpose of a compensating port or valve in a brake master cylinder of an independent brake system?

answer.answerText: Permits the fluid to flow toward or away from the reservoir as temperature changes
Assists in the mater cylinder piston return.
Prevents fluid from flowing back to the reservoir.

question.title: Question: 45
question.questionText: If an aircraft shock strut (air/oil type) bottoms upon initial landing contact, but functions correctly during taxi, the most probable cause is

question.title: Question: 46
question.questionText: What is the function of a cam incorporated in a nose gear shock strut?

answer.answerText: Provides steering of aircraft during ground operation.

question.title: Question: 47
question.questionText: Extension of an oleo shock strut is measured to determine the

answer.answerText: Amount of oil in the strut
Physical condition of the strut itself.
Proper operating position of the strut

question.title: Question: 48
question.questionText: If a shock strut bottoms after it has been properly serviced, the

answer.answerText: Strut should be disassembled and the metering pin orifice plate replaced
Strut should be removed, disassembled and inspected

question.title: Question: 49
question.questionText: The correct in inflation pressure for an aircraft tire can be obtained from

answer.answerText: The information stamped on the aircraft wheel.

question.title: Question: 50
question.questionText: What should be checked when a shock strut bottoms during a landing?

question.title: Question: 51
question.questionText: How can it be determined that all air has been purged from a master cylinder brake system?

answer.answerText: By operating a hydraulic unit and watching the system pressure gauge for smooth, full-scale deflection.
By noting whether the brake is firm or spongy
By noting the amount of fluid return to the master cylinder upon brake release.

question.title: Question: 52
question.questionText: The rubber seals used in a landing gear shock strut

answer.answerText: Are generally designed to be compatible with more than one type of fluid
Are kept from direct contact with fluid by teflon or nylon backup rings.
May be used only with a specific type of fluid

question.title: Question: 53
question.questionText: When a properly operating fusible plug has allowed a tire to deflate, the tire should be

answer.answerText: Removed from the wheel and inspected for carcass and tread damage.

question.title: Question: 54
question.questionText: The fusible plugs installed in some aircraft wheels will

answer.answerText: Melt at a specified elevated temperature

question.title: Question: 55
question.questionText: What action, if any, should be taken when there is a difference of more than 5 pounds of air pressure in tires mounted as duals?

answer.answerText: Correct the discrepancy and enter in logbook
Replace the tire with the lowest pressure.

question.title: Question: 56
question.questionText: How long should you wait after a flight before checking tire pressure?

answer.answerText: At least 2 hours (3 hours in hot weather)
At least 3 hours (4 hours in hot weather).
At least 4 hours (5 hours in hot weather).

question.title: Question: 57
question.questionText: Excessive wear in the shoulder area of an aircraft tire is an indication of

question.title: Question: 58
question.questionText: Excessive wear in the center of the tread of an aircraft tire is an indication of

question.title: Question: 59
question.questionText: When an empty shock strut is filled with fluid, care should be taken to extend and compress the strut completely at least two times to

answer.answerText: Ensure proper packing ring seating and removal of air bubbles

question.title: Question: 60
question.questionText: A pilot reports that the brake pedals have excessive travel. A probable cause is

answer.answerText: Brake lining has oil or some foreign matter on the disks and linings.
Lack of fluid in the brake system.

question.title: Question: 61
question.questionText: Nose gear centering cams are used in many retractable landing gear systems. The primary purpose of the centering device is to

answer.answerText: Align the nosewheel prior to touchdown.
Center the nosewheel before it enters the wheel well

question.title: Question: 62
question.questionText: An O-ring intended for use in a hydraulic system using MIL-H-5606 (mineral base) fluid will be marked with

question.title: Question: 63
question.questionText: What condition would most likely cause excessive fluctuation of the pressure gauge when the hydraulic pump is operating?

question.title: Question: 64
question.questionText: Select the valve used in a hydraulic system that directs pressurized fluid one end of an actuating cylinder and simultaneously directs return fluid to the reservoir from the other end.

question.title: Question: 65
question.questionText: Relief valve are used in pneumatic systems

answer.answerText: To reduce the rate of airflow.

question.title: Question: 66
question.questionText: The removal of air from an aircraft hydraulic system is generally accomplished

answer.answerText: Through automatic bleed valves on individual components during system operation.
By operating the various hydraulic components through several cycles
By allowing the system to remain inoperative for several hours.

question.title: Question: 67
question.questionText: The component in the hydraulic system that is used to direct the flow of fluid is the

question.title: Question: 68
question.questionText: What is the purpose of using backup rings with O-rings in hydraulic systems above 1,500 PSI?

answer.answerText: Prevent internal and external leakage of all moving parts within a hydraulic system.
Provide a seal between two parts of a unit which move in relation to each other.
Prevent high pressure from extruding the seal between the moving and stationary part

question.title: Question: 69
question.questionText: The purpose of the pressure regulator in a hydraulic system is to

answer.answerText: Maintain system operating pressure within a predetermined range and to unload the pump
Regulate the amount of fluid flow to the actuating cylinders within the system.
Prevent failure of components or rupture of hydraulic lines under excessive pressure.

question.title: Question: 70
question.questionText: A flexible sealing element subject to motion is a

question.title: Question: 71
question.questionText: Which characteristics apply to aircraft hydraulic systems? 1. Minimum maintenance requirements. 2. Lightweight. 3. About 80 percent operating efficiency (20 percent loss due to fluid friction). 4. Simple to inspect.

question.title: Question: 72
question.questionText: Generally, the first step in removing an accumulator from an aircraft is to

question.title: Question: 73
question.questionText: The internal resistance of a fluid which tends to prevent it from flowing is called

question.title: Question: 74
question.questionText: (1) When servicing aircraft hydraulic systems, use the type fluid specified in the aircraft manufacturer’s maintenance manual or on the instruction plate affixed to the reservoir or unit. (2) Hydraulic fluids for aircraft are dyed a specific color for each type of fluid Regarding the above statements,

answer.answerText: Both No. 1 and No. 2 are true

question.title: Question: 75
question.questionText: Petroleum base hydraulic fluid is which color?

question.title: Question: 76
question.questionText: Which of the following is adversely affected by atmospheric humidity if left unprotected? 1. MIL-H-5606 hydraulic fluid 2. Skydrol hydraulic fluid. 3. None of the above.

question.title: Question: 77
question.questionText: Which is a characteristic of synthetic base hydraulic fluid?

question.title: Question: 78
question.questionText: Which statement about fluids is correct?

answer.answerText: Any fluid will completely fill its container.
All fluids are considered to be highly compressible.

question.title: Question: 79
question.questionText: Three types of hydraulic fluids currently being used in civil aircraft are

answer.answerText: Mineral base, vegetable, and phosphate ester base
Mineral base, phosphate ester base, and mixed mineral and phosphate ester base.
Mineral base, phosphate ester base, and mixed vegetable and alcohol base.

question.title: Question: 80
question.questionText: Which of the following lists only desirable properties of a good hydraulic fluid?

answer.answerText: High viscosity, low flash point, chemical stability, high fire point.
High flash point, low viscosity, chemical stability, low fire point.
Low viscosity, chemical stability, high flash point, high fire point

question.title: Question: 81
question.questionText: Characteristics of MIL-H-8446 (Skydrol 500 A & B) hydraulic fluid are

answer.answerText: Blue color, phosphate ester base, fire resistant, butyl rubble seals.
Light purple color, phosphate ester base, fire resistant, butyl rubber seals
Light green color, phosphate ester base, fire resistant, butyl rubber seals.

question.title: Question: 82
question.questionText: Characteristics of MIL-H-5606 hydraulic fluid are

answer.answerText: Light purple color, phosphate ester base, fire resistant, butyl rubber seals.
Blue color, vegetable base, will burn, natural rubber seals.
Red color, petroleum base, will burn, synthetic rubber seals

question.title: Question: 83
question.questionText: How the proper hydraulic fluid to be used in an airplane the determined?

answer.answerText: Refer to the aircraft parts manual.
Consult the aircraft Type Certificate Data Sheet.
Consult the aircraft manufacturer’s service manual

question.title: Question: 84
question.questionText: Phosphate ester base hydraulic fluid is very susceptible to contamination from

question.title: Question: 85
question.questionText: The hydraulic component that automatically directs fluid from either the normal source to an actuating cylinder is called a
